title: ‘I lost a friend of almost 40 years’: Nancy Meyers pays tribute to Diane Keaton
summary: A notable film-maker, who directed Diane Keaton in "Something's Gotta Give" and wrote "Baby Boom" and "Father of the Bride," expressed deep sorrow over the loss of a significant figure in the industry, stating, "we have lost a giant." The remark highlights the impact and legacy of the individual who has passed away. This loss is felt profoundly within the film community.

title: UK retail sales growth cools amid fears over budget tax rises
summary: Inflation is impacting sales, according to an industry body, highlighting economic challenges. Barclays reported a decline in credit card spending in September, indicating consumer caution. This trend raises concerns about overall economic activity amid rising prices.

title: Dementia risk for people who quit smoking in middle age ‘same as someone who never smoked’
summary: Recent research indicates that quitting smoking can significantly improve cognitive health by reducing the rate of decline in verbal fluency by 50% and slowing memory loss by 20%. These findings underscore the potential cognitive benefits of cessation efforts. Overall, the study emphasizes the importance of quitting smoking for better mental functioning.

title: Blair’s former policy chief Matthew Taylor to lead Fair Work Agency
summary: The author of a significant report on the gig economy has expressed optimism that a newly established watchdog can effectively improve workers' rights. This initiative aims to address ongoing concerns about the treatment and protections of gig workers. The watchdog's formation is seen as a crucial step towards enhancing labor standards in this sector.
